column2: The Contractor's Nominated Traffic Officer submitted to the Administrator and meets the requirements as specified
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Accreditation Supplied to Administrator
No traffic rearrangements shall be carried out until after the Administrator has advised the Contractor that the submitted, and amended as directed, TMP is approved and suitable for use.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Approval via Contract Notice - Per NTO
All traffic control devices inspected and records kept in accordance with the specification
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Site Records - Daily
In the event of a traffic crash/incident within the site, the Contractor shall record the date and take time and date stamped photographs of the signs/devices in the vicinity of the crash.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Incident Report - Per incident

All TGS's prepared by a suitably qualified person and submitted to the Administrator for review and shall be accompanied with a specific risk assessment, as required. Innovations, alternatives and departures from standards shall be certified by a RPEQ.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - TMD sign off of TGS and, RPEQ Risk Assessment as required
The Traffic Management Inspection report to the Contractor for action, together with documentation of any actions taken in regard to findings.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Submission of report to Administrator - Per inspection
Supervisor/QA Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Project Manager Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Final Sign Offs (to be completed at closure of Lot)
03.09 - Removal of Existing Drainage Structures and Concrete Slabs
column8: 03.09 - Removal of Existing Drainage Structures and Concrete Slabs

column2: Culverts and culvert end structures shall be removed or demolished where specified in the drawings.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Culvert Removal - Per Culvert
If existing culvert components are to be removed and re-used, they shall be removed and stacked in a manner which avoids damaging the components.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual - Per Culvert
Removed components which are not to be salvaged, nor reused, shall be removed from the Site and disposed.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual - Per Culvert
Excavations carried out and the void left by the removed culvert or end structure shall be backfilled to reinstate the area to a safe and free draining state.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual - Per Culvert
Existing kerbs, channels, kerbs and channels, kerb crossings and concrete slabs shall be removed or demolished where specified in the drawings.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual - Per Kerb

Any Kerb and Channel or concrete slab to be removed is saw cut at removal extents or removed to existing joint (or removed in its entirety) where specified in the drawings and no damage shall occur to adjacent work
Kerb excavations shall be backfilled to flush with the surrounding area.
Contractor's Quality Representative Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Administrator's Representative Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Final Sign Offs (to be completed at closure of Lot)
03.10 - Supply and Installation of Precast Concrete Culverts
column8: 03.10 - Supply and Installation of Precast Concrete Culverts

column2: Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Lot size </= 1 Culvert - Per lot
Concrete Pipe culvert components comply with MRTS25/26 Box Culverts Comply with MRTS24
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Manufacture and Test Certificates
All pipes of diameter 800 mm or less shall have spigot and socket joints with rubber sealing rings. Joints for other sizes shall be as specified on the drawings.
Component size, wall thickness and class is as specified in the drawings
Bandage Covers are a Proprietary Product, either: Synthetic or Rubber Band, samples inspected by administrator
Culvert Construction Procedures to be accepted prior to commencement of Installation
Excavations shall be carried out in accordance with Clause 13 of MRTS04 General Earth works

Where Unsuitable Material (in accordance with the provisions of Cl. 9.2) or potentially unsuitable Material is encountered on site the contactor shall, before proceding with removal, shall notify the Administrator. Once Identified the Unsuitable material shall be removed and disposed of in accordance with the provisions of Cl. 9.3 and CL.11.3
Bottom of excavation compaction tested. 0 - 150mm below foundation -RDD Q140A
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Cl 15, Table 15.3(b) CV 95% minimum (1 tests / 50m2 - min 2 / lot)
Components are assembled as per manufaturers specifications, and if possible, contruction commenced at outlet
Pipes shall be placed with their external grooved ends or spigot ends facing the culvert outlet

The pipes shall be laid with the lifting hole or "TOP" marking uppermost. Lifting holes shall be plugged or otherwise closed off in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions after the pipe is installed.
Placed with external groove or spigot end facing outlet with minimum of 50mm bedding material
The horizontal alignment of culverts shall not vary from the location specified in the Drawings by more than ± 100 mm
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - ± 100mm (All points shown on drawings - min 1 per 20m or 3 points)
The invert heights of culverts shall not vary from those specified by more than ± 10 mm and nowhere shall the grades of culverts depart from those specified by more than 1%
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - ± 10mm, ± 1% grade (All points shown on drawings - min 1 per 20m or 3 points)
Backfilling of culverts shall not commence until all the conformance and As Constructed Survey requirements have been met and notice of such works provided to the Administrator
Backfill material shall not be placed until culverts, structures, pipes, conduits, pits, etc have been completed and inspected, and any specified curing periods have elapsed.

Overlay material within 300 mm of the structure, culvert, pipe, etc shall be general back fill Class A1, A2 or B material conforming to MRTS04 Cl.19.2.2 excep 100% material shall pass 25.0mm test sieve.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Class A1:
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Top 300mm below Subgrade Level ≥97%, Greater than 300mm below Subgrade Level ≥95% (1 test / 50m3, min 1 per lot)
Moisture content within ranges specified Rainfall Zone: HIGH
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Class A1/A2: 70-100%, Class B: 80-110%
CCTV inspection undertaken, report submitted and accepted by administrator. Visual inspection may be approved by the Administrator in lieu of CCTV inspection.
Supervisor/QA Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Project Manager Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Final Sign Offs (to be completed at closure of Lot)
03.11 - Installation of Culvert Components and Structures - Precast or In-Situ
column8: 03.11 - Installation of Culvert Components and Structures - Precast or In-Situ

column2: Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Lot size </= 1 Culvert - Per lot
Culvert Construction Procedures accept prior to commencement of Installation
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Administrator Approval - Per Project
Excavations shall be carried out in accordance with Clause 13 of MRTS04 General Earthworks.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual - Per lot

Where Unsuitable Material (in accordance with the provisions of Cl. 9.2) or potentially unsuitable Material is encountered on site the contactor shall, before proceding with removal, shall notify the Administrator. Once Identified the Unsuitable material shall be removed and disposed of in accordance with the provisions of Cl. 9.2 and CL.11
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual - Per lot
Bottom of excavation compaction tested. 0 - 150mm below foundation - AS 1289.5.4.1 or AS1289.5.7.1
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Cl 15, Table 15.3(b) CV 95% minimum (1 tests / 50m2 - min 2 / lot)
Cast In Situ material: In accordance with MRTS03 Cl.6.1, MRTS 70 and MRTS71
Precast: Installed in accordance with MRTS03-Components shall be laid on a foundation bedding which provides continuous even support to the structures.

Precast: Culverts shall be joined to shafts/pits to form watertight joints using cement mortar. Cement mortar shall be used within one hour of mixing and shall not be re-tempered. The joints shall be finished to given smooth surfaces which are uniform with the surfaces of the shafts.
Gullies/Chambers: Vertical Tolerances: Invert heights shall not vary from those specified by the Drawings by more than ± 50 mm
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - ±50mm (All points specified on drawings)
Gullies/Chambers: Vertical Tolerances: The heights of the tops of back-units, grates and frames shall not vary from those described in the Drawings by more than ± 10 mm
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - ±10mm (All points specified on drawings)

Horizontal tolerances: Gullies: shall not vary from those specified in the Drawings by more than ± 100 mm in the direction of the construction centre line and ± 50 mm in the direction at right angles to the construction centre line. Access Chambers: shall not vary from those specified in the Drawings by more than ±100mm
Gullies/Chambers: join neatly to existing drainage structures, do not pond water unnecessarily and are at heights compatible with other adjacent structures.

Gullies/Chambers: Grates on gullies or Concrete top slabs on precast concrete access chambers shall not be installed until all the surveying requirements have been met and notice of such works provided to the Administrator
Check Item - Hold Point 5, Hold Point 6
Backfilling of culverts shall not commence until all the conformance and As Constructed Survey requirements have been met and notice of such works provided to the Administrator

Prior to incorporating any Backfill material into the Works, the Contractor shall submit stockpile or source tests results as specified in Appendix A which demonstrate the source meets the specified material requirements
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Quarry Material Test Results

Material for backfill shall be as shown on the drawings or as specified elsewhere in the ContractEarth Backfill Material shall comply with the requirements of Earth Fill Material Class A1, Class A2 or Class B specified in Clause 14.2.2 except that 100% of the material shall pass 25.0 mm test sieve.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Test Results

Overlay material within 300 mm of the structure, culvert, pipe, etc shall be general back fill Class A1, A2 or B material conforming to MRTS04 Cl.19.2.2 except 100% material shall pass 25.0mm test sieve. Else where material may contain stone sized up to 150mm maximum dimension
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Class A: WPI < 1200, PI > 7, % passing 0.075mm: 15 - 30
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Top 300mm below Subgrade Level ≥97%
○ Greater than 300mm below Subgrade Level ≥95% (1 test / 50m3, min 1 per lot)
Moisture content within ranges specified Rainfall Zone: HIGH
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Class A: 70-100%, Class B: 80-110%

A water test on a side inlet gully shall be carried out where the longitudinal grade is less than 1%. Water shall be discharged into the side inlet gully to check uniformity of flow. After the flow has ceased, water shall not pond to a depth of more than 5 mm in any section of the channel.
CCTV inspection undertaken, report submitted and accepted by administrator.
Supervisor/QA Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Project Manager Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Final Sign Offs (to be completed at closure of Lot)
